items.title: House Votes to Kill Bill Allowing Senators to Sue Government
items.summary: The measure has prompted a backlash, but the top Senate Republican appeared inclined to preserve it, arguing that it would protect the body against investigatory overreach.

items.title: Florida Lawmaker Stole FEMA Funds for House Campaign, Prosecutors Say
items.summary: Representative Sheila Cherfilus-McCormick misused $5 million in Covid-related funds during the pandemic in part to finance her campaign, according to the Justice Department.

items.title: Larry Summers to Stop Teaching at Harvard While It Investigates His Epstein Ties
items.summary: The former Harvard president had previously stepped down from other positions following revelations about his longtime connections to Jeffrey Epstein.

items.title: Why Does Trump, the ‘America First’ President, Keep Looking to Foreign Leaders?
items.summary: Trump keeps showing he is not as isolationist as many supporters had hoped.

items.title: Stalled Contempt Inquiry Into Deportation Flights Springs Back to Life
items.summary: The resurrected inquiry could finally get to the bottom of lingering questions such as: Did top Trump administration officials purposely ignore a court order?

items.title: Appeals Court Blocks Limits on Federal Agents’ Use of Force in Chicago Area
items.summary: A judge found that immigration agents were using force in a way that “shocks the conscience.” Appellate judges said the restrictions she imposed went too far.

items.title: Trump and Mamdani to meet in Oval Office on Friday after months of bickering
items.summary: <p>President has previously criticised the New York City mayor-elect, labelling him a ‘communist’ and threatening to deport him</p><p>Donald Trump has confirmed a long-awaited meeting with New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani will happen in Washington this week, setting up an in-person clash between the political opposites who for months have antagonised each other.</p><p>The sit-down, which Trump said on social media would take place on Friday in the Oval Office, could possibly represent a detente of sorts between the Republican president and Democratic rising star.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/20/donald-trump-zohran-mamdani-nyc-mayor-elect-meeting">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump says he signed bill to release Epstein files, then announces meeting with Zohran Mamdani – as it happened
items.summary: <p>This live blog is now closed.</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/19/trump-news-at-a-glance-latest-updates-today">Trump news at a glance: president signs bill to release more Epstein documents</a></p></li></ul><p></p><p>One quick note, <strong>there haven’t been any changes to Donald Trump’s schedule today, per the press pool</strong>. Which means, as of now, the president doesn’t have any time allotted to sign the bill forcing the justice department to release the full batch of Jeffrey Epstein files.</p><p>We’ll keep you updated if things change throughout the day.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/19/us-congress-epstein-files-donald-trump-saudi-arabia-redistricting-latest-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>
